Class MonadPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
com.interworldtransport.cladosviewer.MonadPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class MonadPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.FocusListener
com.interworldtransport.cladosviewer.MonadPanel The MonadPanel class directly handles the gui for a single Monad.

Version:
0.85
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Constructor Details

    • MonadPanel

      public MonadPanel​(CladosCalculator pGUI) throws UtilitiesException
      The MonadPanel class is intended to be contain a cladosG Monad in order to offer its parts for display and manipulation by the calculator
      Parameters:
      pGUI - CladosCalculator
      Throws:
      UtilitiesException - This is the general exception. Could be any miscellaneous issue. Ready the message to see.

    • MonadPanel

      public MonadPanel​(CladosCalculator pGUI, com.interworldtransport.cladosG.MonadRealF pM) throws UtilitiesException
      The MonadPanel class is intended to hold a single Monad and act as its GUI. This constructor is the base one.
      Parameters:
      pGUI - CladosCalculator This is just a reference to the owner application so error messages can be presented.
      pM - MonadRealF This is a reference to the monad to be displayed and manipulated.
      Throws:
      UtilitiesException - This is the general exception. Could be any miscellaneous issue. Ready the message to see.

    • MonadPanel

      public MonadPanel​(CladosCalculator pGUI, java.lang.String pName, java.lang.String pAName, java.lang.String pFrame, java.lang.String pFoot, java.lang.String pSig) throws UtilitiesException, com.interworldtransport.cladosGExceptions.BadSignatureException, com.interworldtransport.cladosGExceptions.CladosMonadException
      The MonadPanel class is intended to hold a single Monad and act as its GUI. This constructor is the base one upon which the others call with their special cases.
      Parameters:
      pGUI - CladosCalculator
      pName - String Name of the Monad to be constructed
      pAName - String Name of the Algebra to be constructed
      pFrame - String Frame name to be associated with the Monad
      pFoot - String Foot name to be used by the Algebra
      pSig - String Signature to be used by the GProduct of the Algebra
      Throws:
      com.interworldtransport.cladosGExceptions.BadSignatureException - This exception is thrown when one of the monad panels can't accept the string signature offered. That happens when something other than '+' or '-' is used... or maybe when signature is too long. Remember that blade count is currently tracked with a short integer. {--****
      com.interworldtransport.cladosGExceptions.CladosMonadException - This exception gets thrown when there is a general issue constructing a monad besides the exceptions for which specific ones have been written. Read the contained message.
      UtilitiesException - This is the general exception. Could be any miscellaneous issue. Ready the message to see.

    • getJCoeffs

      public java.util.ArrayList<FieldAreaRealF> getJCoeffs()
      This method provides to the caller an array list of the JTextArea descendents that hold coefficients for a monad. In this case they are RealF coefficients. It's just a typical get method, though. Nothing special.
      Returns:
      ArrayList An array list of JTextArea descedents is returned that holds the coefficients of a monad.

    • getMonad

      public com.interworldtransport.cladosG.MonadRealF getMonad()
      This method provides to the caller a MonadRealF held in this panel. It's just a typical get method, though. Nothing special.
      Returns:
      MonadRealF

    • setCoefficientDisplay

      public void setCoefficientDisplay()
      In this method we assume the underlying Monad has changed and the displayField in the panel has to be updated. This means working through the Coeff's for the Monad and updating the displayField in the related JTextArea. It is safe enough to call this from anywhere and at any time. The worst that can happen is the user looses some of their changes on the UI.

    • makeWritable

      protected void makeWritable()
      This method adjusts the JTextArea elements contained on the panel to allow for edits. It has two modes since this panel does too. In one mode the coefficients are visible and made editable too. In the other, they aren't visible, so this method skips them.

    • registerTextChange

      protected void registerTextChange​(javax.swing.JTextField pTextField)
      This method registers a Focus Listener for a JTextField (likely a descedent of one) so the Monad Panel can respond to events.
      Parameters:
      pTextField - JTextField
